overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach for short-term forecasting using simple averaging methods due to limited data. It focuses on identifying daily seasonality and stationarity while avoiding complex models, prioritizing straightforward pattern replication for the forecast horizon.
key_insights: Grouping data by hour and averaging across days to capture daily patterns
Verifying stationarity by comparing daily min/max values before applying averaging
Repeating the averaged hourly pattern for the entire forecast horizon
Handling date-time formatting and alignment for multi-day forecasts
Rounding forecasted values to match input data precision (3 decimals)
complexity_analysis: Mostly simple heuristics with basic statistical calculations, avoiding complex models due to limited data (only 4 days available). Focuses on practical implementation over theoretical sophistication.
